oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Map of the Straights of Niagara from Lake Erie to Lake Ontario
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Atlas etching shows key military sites along the Niagara River. From James Wilkinson, "Diagrams and Plans, Illustrative of the Principle Battles and Military Affairs, Treated of in Memoirs of My Own Times."

Controversial figure General James Wilkinson served in the Revolution and War of 1812. In 1787, he turned traitor and became a secret agent for Spain. After Thomas Jefferson purchased the Louisiana Territory from France, he appointed Wilkinson governor. Wilkinson was later accused of treason for his participation in Aaron Burr's conspiracy to separate Louisiana from the U.S. Their goal was to create an independent nation friendly to Spain. Wilkinson betrayed Burr and aided in his capture.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wilkinson, James, 1757-1825;United States. Navy--History--Revolution, 1775-1783, [War of 1812, etc.];United States History War of 1812
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wilkinson, James, 1757-1825
